description: Battle up to 3 other ninjas in Card-Jitsu Fire, the ultimate test of speed and power. Land on an element, play your cards and the highest number will win.
Skilled ninjas show their mastery of the element of fire, battling with hot sauce. They never spill a drop on their ninja suit and they don't fear it on their pizza.
Ninja students all over the island helped to stoke the fires of a long dormant Volcano in the hills of Club Penguin. Even their black puffles joined in!

name: Goldsmith Apron
description: Here's a tip if you're a ninja, you can buy a Goldsmith Apron inside the Hideout (beside the Dojo). If you wear this item then dance, your penguin will forge gold!
Ninjas face off in a match of Card-Jitsu Fire atop the great Volcano. Each ninja student must master the element of fire to earn legendary items such as the Fire Gem.

name: Volcano
description: This distant mountain in the hills of Club Penguin had lay dormant for years. It wasn't until September 2009 that penguins realized that is was actually a Volcano!
Ninjas practice their Card-Jitsu poses before pouncing into action. Here, we see a ninja preparing to go into a Card-Jitsu Fire battle, where you must play the best element card to win.
Only ninjas can access this quaint little shop at the heart of the Ninja Hideout beside the Dojo. The magical Amulet is the most popular item sold here.
Land on this square in a game of Card-Jitsu Fire, and youll face a battle against another ninja. Remember, fire beats snow, snow beats water, water beats fire.
Back in September 2009, construction on the entrance to the Volcano began at the Hideout. Sensei built a path to the top of the Volcano, and we worked together to build the Fire Dojo!

name: Fire Gem
description: See how the fire symbol glows? Once a ninja student has mastered the element of fire, Sensei will award them with a Fire Gem. Only then will the fire symbol glow in the Ninja Hideout.

name: Scavenger Hunt
description: Sensei asked ninja students to gather fiery items from all over the island. We used these items to stoke the Volcano. It was time for our next ninja journey!
Ninjas gathered fiery items from all around the island to make the Volcano even hotter. It sparked great events, starting with a great storm which hit the island just before Halloween.
We drew these ninjas back in August 2009 while we were working up some stuff for Card-Jitsu Fire. Some of these were made into real world "pop-up" cards.
The powerful stone statues at the Fire Dojo watch over ninja students as they learn to master the element of fire. Beyond the mighty Fire Suit!
We aren't quite sure about this tub of hot sauce at the Fire Dojo. Is it pouring hot sauce into the Volcano, or is the lava actually hot sauce? This mystery remains...
Here's the original sketch of the Fire Dojo from May 2009. In the finished version we added a tub of hot sauce, and changed the outfit on the statue a bit!

name: November 2008
description: Sensei first appeared outside the Dojo in November 2008, where he was seen digging snow with a shovel. Almost a year later, he helped awaken the great Volcano...
This is a sketch we drew of Sensei in front of the Volcano entrance. We made this for a scene on our website back in September 2009, but ended up never using it!
Take the next step along the ninja path. Journey across the narrow bridge to the Fire Dojo, where you will learn to master the element of fire to become a Fire Ninja.
The entrance to the Volcano can only be opened by those who own the Amulet. To enter, click the stone table and uncover the hidden door to the secret Fire Dojo.

name: Sensei's Fire Robes
description: Sensei is a master of Card-Jitsu Fire. As you challenge other ninja students and earn experience, Sensei will award you with pieces of the Fire Ninja Suit.

name: Monkey King
description: A quick-thinking trickster, always ready for adventure. The Monkey King must face a great quest in the play "Secrets of the Bamboo Forest".
Soaring through the air at top speed, penguin pilots master the art of Jet Packing. Head to the Beacon to take off on Jet Pack Adventure!
Fairies and Princesses go together like fish and pizza. Both have been spotted during plays, Halloween, and the Medieval Party.

name: salon chairs
description: Does your puffle want to try out a new hairdo? These salon chairs first appeared during the Puffle Party 2010. They are now available in the Pet Shop.
Every year for Halloween, more and more costumes appear at the Gift Shop. Trick-or-treaters should not be surprised to see dragons or Franken-fairies around the island.
During the Halloween Party, penguins looking to show off their custom costumes can waddle over to the costume show. Monsters and ladybugs alike are welcome!
Soccer is a very popular pastime on the island. Whether two or twenty two penguins are playing, the action is always epic. Get your game on at the Stadium!

name: Bean Counters
description: Unloading the Coffee Shop truck is one of the oldest jobs on the island. And as long as penguins need their coffee, the Coffee Shop will need someone to help unload the beans.
During the Penguin Play Awards, interviewers are always busy. Everyone is invited to sit in the chair and share their thoughts on the Stage plays and awards. Everyone!
To play soccer at the Stadium, you've got to be quick. Click on the soccer ball to run over and kick it. The faster you're going, the faster the ball will go!
These are sketches of characters from "Secrets of the Bamboo Forest". We drew lots of different designs for their costumes before we decided on these ones.

name: Mine Cave
description: When a rockslide in the Mine revealed hidden caves, crews moved in to make them safe to explore. "We're off to a rocky start," said Rory, "but that's normal for a cave."
Revealed by a rockslide in January of 2010, this dark cave is a construction worker's dream. Penguins can mine for gold with jackhammers, or help keep the lights powered with snowballs.

name: Guardian Dog
description: This costume from "Secrets of the Bamboo Forest" gives you the power to turn into a statue. Just press 'W' on your keyboard! The perfect skill for patient guardians...
Every September, penguins look forward to the island's famous Fair. There are many special games, prizes and shows to see... so step right up!
Hockey players can find all their equipment in the Snow and Sports catalog at the Stadium. The proper gear is important before stepping onto the ice.

name: Puffle Show
description: The Puffle Show premiered during the Puffle Party in 2010. Penguins took their furry friends there to compete in an exciting obstacle course.
Even during the colder months, many penguins enjoy bundling up and playing in the snow. Making snowmen, caroling and snowball fights are very popular activities during this time.
The Stadium was upgraded to allow bigger crows to attend hockey and soccer games. Complete with bleachers, new lighting and booths for food vendors.
Nothing spruces up an igloo like a few items from the Better Igloos catalog. Puffles especially love it when there are lots of things to play with.
Music Jam is the island's annual music festival. It's all about finding the right styles, sounds and moves to express yourself.

name: Test Glider
description: During the Festival of Flight, many penguins used the Test Glider to take to the skies. Aviator goggles were a must have!

name: Puffle Paddle
description: You need fast flippers and sharp reflexes to play Puffle Paddle. Juggle as many puffles as you can, and earn tons of tickets in this popular Fair game.
The island's fanciest fashions can be seen on the red carpet during the Penguin Play Awards. All the latest styles can be found at the Gift Shop.
Visitors to the Dock will find the Hydro Hopper boat all fueled up and ready to go. Jump in for some extreme tubing, or just chill out and catch some sun.

name: Orange Puffle
description: The zaniest of all puffles, these curious creatures were first discovered at the Puffle Party in 2010. Their buckteeth and quirky personalities make them stand out in any crowd.
The entire community of Club Penguin helped plant this special tree during the Earth Day celebration in 2010. Many believe it will be the tallest tree on the island someday.
Many penguins have a passion for gardening. So during the Earth Day celebration in 2010, a community garden was planted at the Mine Shack. Now anyone can go there and plant vegetables!

name: Island Adventure Party
description: In June of 2010, penguins were invited to dress up as pirates, captains, and even castaways. Mermaids and sailors in seafaring dresses were also spotted during the celebration.

name: clothing racks
description: In 2010, the Better Igloos catalog began selling clothing racks and displays so penguins could set up their own shops. Now there are many unique and interesting showing up all over the island,

name: Seafarer's Gown
description: A popular costume during the Island Adventure Party. The Seafarer's Gown and Bonny Curls were perfect for any gal that wanted to sail while looking their best.
Music Jam is about more than just music! The island's annual festival is about finding the best styles and sounds to express yourself, including your best dance moves.
Rock is a popular style of music during Music Jam, the island's annual music festival. Many penguins enjoy breaking out there electric guitars and rocking out at the Lighthouse.
Pop concerts are a huge hit with audiences. During the Music Jam festival, the Beach is set up with all the lights and sound systems a pop star needs!

name: Norman Swarm
description: This Stage play featured Norman, a shrunken penguin who must befriend a swarm of bugs to help him. Together they find a way to return Norman to his normal size.
Puffle rescuers need to have quick reflexes, and nerves of steel. Navigating dangerous ice floes, treacherous caverns and dangerous creatures is all part of the job.

name: Everyday Phoning Facility
description: This is an average Everyday Phoning Facility, over in the Ski Village. There's nothing to see here... unless you happen to receive an invitation to the Elite Penguin Force...
Gary the Gadget Guy, inventor of the jet pack, makes sure there's always enough for everyone. That makes a LOT of jet packs.

name: Pumpkin Igloo
description: Nothing says Halloween like pumpkins for your igloo... except make a pumpkin igloo! This special igloo design only appears during Halloween in the Igloo Upgrades catalog.
In May of 2010, PSA agents were called in to stop one of Herbert's plans. Though agents saved everyone from harm, Herbert managed to destroy the PSA's HQ with a popcorn device.
During the Island Adventure Party, a group of classy captains banded together to try and battle the pirates. They did their best to find more treasure, and have more adventures than anyone else.
April Fools is a strange but funny celebration in Club Penguin. There's all sorts of weird silliness happening. It's easy to join in,-pull a prank, or tell a crazy joke.

name: The Great Snow Maze
description: During November of 2009, penguins were invited to solve the Great Snow Maze. Many penguins worked together to reach the end, and were awarded with a Yeti costume.

name: Jacques Hammer
description: This penguin private investigator is one of the stars of the Stage play "Ruby and the Ruby". He's a no-nonsense penguin who doesn't miss a clue, and always finds what he's looking for.
During the April Fools Party, the entire island goes topsy-turvy. Those who join in the fun may even be crowned the King of April Fools... though kings are crowned every few minutes.
To join the Elite Penguin Force, first you must complete The Test. This Test will challenge all of an agent's skills, including their speed, stealth and how clever they are.

name: Cloud Maker 3000
description: During the Festival of Flight, a machine called the Cloud-Maker 3000 could make clouds of different shapes. Anvil clouds turned out to be surprisingly heavy!
These ultra-rare items are only available to those who have entered at least 5 codes into the Treasure Book. Codes can be found on games, books and other Club Penguin toys.
In January 2010, the whole island was surprised by a rockslide in the Mine. Construction crews quickly cleaned up the mess, and discovered a number of hidden caves.
Mer-penguins have shown up in many places. From the Underwater Adventure Stage play, to the Island Adventure Party, mer-penguins are a welcome addition to any celebration.

name: Puffer Fish
description: One of the many hazards that Aqua Grabber pilots need to avoid. These puffer fish can inflate to almost a hundred times their normal size, and their spikes can do a lot of damage.

name: watering pack
description: Released during the Earth Day celebration in 2010, this watering pack keeps water from freezing, now penguins can water their gardens no matter how cold it is.
During the Earth Day celebration, penguins decided it was time to fix up the Mine Shack. So everyone pitched in to help build a large community garden there.

name: Puffle Circus
description: Come one, come all, to the great Puffle Circus! Only in town during the Fair, penguins can see puffles of all colors perform amazing acts!
This sketch shows a yellow and blue puffle using items from their "super plays". It was used for an Aunt Arctic article, and it inspired the webpage we use for our Puffle Documentary video.

name: Popcorn Party
description: An unexpected pile of popcorn appeared at the Ski Village in May 2010, so penguins decided to throw a Popcorn Party. It took two weeks to eat the whole pile!
During the island's annual Puffle Party, each puffle color has a room decorated in its honor. When the white puffle was discovered, the Mine was turned into an icy paradise.

name: green puffle room
description: This sketch shows a small part of the green puffle room from the Puffle Party of 2010. The final picture made the cover of the newspaper!

name: Fishbowl Igloo
description: One of the more unusual igloo designs, the Fishbowl Igloo lets you see the world from the eyes of a Fluffy fish. It can be found from time to time in the Better Igloos catalog.

name: Ship Battle Adventure
description: The competition between pirates and captains reached epic proportions during the Island Adventure Party. A great battle awaited those who dared to join in!
Secret protectors of Club Penguin, the Elite Penguin Force can tackle any emergency. When the PSA was destroyed by Herbert, the EPF took over all secret agent operations.
Whenever Rockhopper visits Club Penguin, he writes down all the things he's looking forward to doing. He posts this list on the notice board down in the Migrator's Hold.

name: Hidden Lake
description: Deep underground is a secret cave filled with water, called the Hidden Lake. To find it, you'll need to journey into the caves beyond the mine, or find the other hidden entrance...

name: Spooky Igloo Contest
description: October 2010 saw a return of the spooky igloo contest. Penguins who picked up costumes and furniture items can keep the spine-chilling style all year 'round.
We prepared for Halloween 2010 with a chilling countdown and creepy costumes. Then, we searched for candy in the Swamp Quest.

name: Stormy Skies
description: Stormy skies rolled over the island and cast shadows over October 2010's Halloween festivities. In November the dark clouds burst with the first ever rain in Club Penguin.

name: 5th Anniversary Party
description: October 24th 2010 was the 5th Anniversary Party in Club Penguin. Penguins earned a Celebration Stamp for blowing out the candles on the massive cake in the Coffee Shop.

name: Anniversary Cake
description: Club Penguin turned five at the October 24th Anniversary Party! Penguins found a party hat and orange puffles were excited to share the giant Anniversary cake.

name: 5th Anniversary Yearbook
description: During the Anniversary Party of 2010, we celebrated the past year with a brand new Yearbook and original penguin artwork in the Book Room.
Snowball: a ball of snow pressed together to throw. Or... an excuse to get your snow gear on and head to the Snow Forts for a frozen fight!

name: Find Four
description: Challenge your buddy to a game of Find Four in the Ski Lodge. While you're there, you may also see a giant mullet, a moose head and Fred the Cuckoo clock bird.
After playing in the snow or at the Ice Rink with your white puffle, chill together by the fire at the Ski Lodge.
The Holiday Party 2010 was full of festive costumes and igloo items. In typical penguin fashion, we were thrilled to decorate our igloos... and ourselves.
The Book Room above the Coffee Shop is filled with Yearbook memories and tall tales, too! You might even discover a few secrets inside some of the pages...

name: Haunted House
description: After putting on their creepy costumes in the October Penguin Style, Frankenpenguins and other monsters braved their way through the Forest to find the Haunted House.
The brown puffle pet is super smart, inventive, and wears safety goggles. It's a good thing because its rocket is a bit unpredictable.
At The Fair in September 2010, we played games, earned tickets and won fabulous prizes! Puffles and penguins performed magic tricks at stages Rockhopper brought.
During the Holiday Party 2010, penguins got their skates from the Snow and Sports catalog and spent time with their buddies at the Ice Rink.
When the Migrator docks at the Beach, you can play Rockhopper's special Treasure Hunt game. Find it, and maybe find a few really rare gems, in the Captain's Quarters.

name: Lumberjack Look
description: The Lumberjack Look outfit from the January Penguin Style catalog got us in the spirit of adventure! We needed it to complete the Wilderness Expedition 2011.

name: Pink Sparkle Snowshoes
description: In January 2011 the Pink Sparkly Snowshoes hit Penguin Style just in time for the Wilderness Expedition. Who says exploration gear can't be stylish?
The Holiday Party 2010 was full of surprises. Penguins discovered a mysterious room called "???". There, they found the biggest and brightest tree ever seen in Club Penguin.

name: Coins For Change 2010
description: During Coins For Change 2010, Rockhopper challenged everyone to "Fill the Lighthouse!" Penguins gave over 12 billion Club Penguin coins that helped real kids around the world.
Penguin explorers had to make this elevator machine work during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011. Experts presume the brown puffle invented it.
Building the boat during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011 was a challenge. But getting to adopt a brown puffle across the bay was worth it.

name: Wilderness Expedition Cave
description: During the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011, we completed several challenges, including a maze and a boat ride across the bay. Then we discovered the brown puffle!

name: Water Suits
description: Brave ninjas can battle opponents at the Waterfall behind the Dojo and earn Water Suits. Press 'D' when you wear only your suit and demonstrate your power to control water.
Your Stamp Books help you track the things you've done on the island. And while you can't really turn yourself into one, you CAN customize yours!
We geared up in expedition gear from Penguin Style and then found adventures during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011. In the end, we discovered the brown puffle!
Protecting the Earth, Building Safe places and Providing Medical Help are things we can rally around! During Coins For Change 2010, penguins gave over 12 billion Club Penguin coins. Yes, BILLION!
Penguins can choose their color from the Penguin Style catalog! In 2006 players voted to get Lime Green added, and in 2009 players chose Aqua over lavender and maroon.

name: Fairy Fables
description: September 2010 saw a return of the popular Fairy Fables play at the Stage. Penguins interested in acting auditioned for the roles of characters like Twee and the Big Bad Wool.
This sketch was created when the Elite Penguin Force agents started doing Field Ops in June 2010. Secret agents work together to get things done.
The Cove is a place we go to tell stories and play the Catchin' Waves game. If you've taken on the waves there, you've probably got some extreme tales to tell.
During the Fair in September 2010, the orange puffle joined the circus and zoomed around the tent it its vehicle. The finale was eating the car.
The first ever game in Club Penguin, Hydro Hopper was formerly known as Ballistic Biscuit. Head to the Dock to grab your inner tube and challenge the waters.
To change up your igloo, choose a new design, get some furniture items, and decorate. Then throw a party and invite your friends.
During Underwater Adventure, brave penguin divers go on a journey. Along the way they discover a grumpy fish who tells them about the lost city of Penglantis.

name: Questions for a Crab
description: Herbert made his first appearance in the PSA mission "Questions for a Crab". After capturing a Secret Agent, he explained his life story and dastardly plans. His flow chart contained over 30 hand drawn pages.

name: Enemy Bots
description: Agents must protect against many different kinds of enemies in the game System Defender. Each has its own strengths and weaknesses. Find out more in G's tutorial in the Command Room.

name: Paint By Letters
description: In the Book Room, find these special books to hone your keyboard skills, shape your own story, and even find a few secrets!
Classified: To become an Elite Agent, respond to an invitation from another agent. Then head to the Everyday Phoning Facility to take the training test. Your duty? Protect the island.
The brains of the Elite Penguin Force, the Tech Class, are technology experts. Dressed as civilians, they shut down enemy defenses via their computers.
In May 2010, Herbert's popcorn explosion meant we had to replace the Sport Shop with the Everyday Phoning Facility. Nothing unusual ever happens there...
Black puffles often look grumpy. But don't let their exterior fool you. They're excellent pets who excel with skateboards... They'll even help you in the Cart Surfer game.

name: Sumo Smash
description: Smashing your opponents off the 'berg will get you one step closer to conquering the island. Sumo Smash is a game made especially for Club Penguin's Game Day for Wii.
Very inventive, your brown puffle will surprise you with its elaborate creations. Adopt this machine-making puffle from the Pet Shop!
Reindeer, elves and puffles were seen gathering around the massive tree during the December 2010 Holiday Party. We decorated it ourselves!

name: Boss Bugs
description: These three Boss Bugs were sketched in the summer of 2010. The artists wanted them to look as if they could harm a computer system. Elite Agents can attack these Club Penguin enemies in System Defense in the Command Room.

name: Tall Tree Maze
description: Adventurous penguins can puffles made their way through the Tall Trees to find the new brown puffle during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011.

name: Sled 'n Slide
description: Teamwork is key when you're flying down the hill on a sled with your friends in Sled 'n Slide game for Wii... Get a good time and your team will be closer to conquering Club Penguin Island!
For a long time, players asked for a stage set under the water. So the Club Penguin team made one! In Underwater Adventure, you can get the costumes of Toby the Lobster, a Mermaid, or a Merman.

name: lifejackets
description: During the Wilderness Expedition, we had to take a boat to get across the bay. But first we had to build it and put our lifejackets on!
From the Lodge, you can get to the Ice Fishing game and catch fish. Shhhh... To get the giant mullet use a smaller fish as bait!
"Step right up to the most daring, extravagant, ama-a-a-a-zing puffle circus!" Talented puffles performed and Ringmasters directed the shows during The Fair 2010.

name: Black Puffle
description: It's intense and it has some incredible skate tricks, too. If you want some Cart Surfer help, or just a really cool pet, adopt a black puffle from the Pet Shop.
Club Penguin artists had a lot of fun sketching how the brown puffle might play. The scientific pet was discovered during the Wilderness Expedition in January 2011.

name: Java Jump
description: Race your opponents to the finish line! The Java Jump game in Club Penguin's Game Day for Wii will have you jumping... unless you pick up a heavy anvil along the way.
The opening of the Water Dojo is November 2010 meant a celebration of all elemental skills in Club Penguin. Puffles like the elements, too.
Fairy Fables is the tale of Prince Redwood who rides through the forest to take croissants to a princess. Check the Stage for a trunk full of costumes and acting opportunities.
First discovered in the Forest in 2007, yellow puffles are artistic pets. Adopt one from the Pet Shop and take it into your igloo. Then watch it get creative!

name: Green Puffle
description: The green puffle's a great pal for getting silly. Adopt one at the Pet Shop and try taking it into the Jetpack Adventure game at the Beacon.

It takes a long time to plan new rooms. Artists sketched the Elite Agent training and testing room in January 2010, way before the Everyday Phoning Facility opened for Elite Agents at the end of May 2010.

name: Snowball Battle
description: In Club Penguin Game Day for Wii, winning snowball battles take precision. But it also helps if you know a secret... find the white puffle for some extra snowball action!

name: Purple Puffle
description: It's particular  except when it's on the dance floor. Then it'll show you some great moves. Adopt one from the Pet Shop and then take it to the Dance Contest game to help you.
This early sketch of the Water Dojo had a few more "polished" elements than it does now. We wanted the area to be quite rough and even a bit perilous to reflect the challenge of the water game.

name: Orange Puffle
description: Known for its willingness to chomp on everything, the orange puffle is a wacky pet. Adopt yours at the Club Penguin Pet Shop  and keep an eye on your pizza.

name: Pink Puffle
description: Pink puffles are sporty creatures  they also like water. Adopt a pink puffle at the Pet Shop and take it into the Aqua Grabber game to help you!

name: Goal!
description: You've picked your team... your skates are laced tight. Now guard your net and shoot pucks for the win! Goal!

name: White Puffle
description: First spotted in the Dojo, the shy, snow-loving white puffle holds extraordinary power. Adopt one from the Club Penguin Pet Shop.

name: Blue Puffle
description: Loyalty is what blue puffles are all about. If you're looking to expand your team with an all-star pet, adopt one in the Pet Shop.

name: Feed a Puffle
description: All the puffles are hungry in the Club Penguin Wii "Feed A Puffle" Game. But try extra hard to feed a white one  you can get a Stamp in Club Penguin when you feed one.

Ninjas compete fiercely in the Dojo to improve their Card-Jitsu skills. After earning their Ninja Mask, many continue to battle to keep their senses sharp. New Power Cards can surprise even the most skilled opponents.

Sensei's past is shrouded in mystery. He is the first master of Card-Jitsu, but little else is known about him. He will, however gladly train any student interested in the ways of the ninja. Seek him in the Dojo for training.

Even after you've earned their Ninja Mask, your ninja's training has only begun. The next step of your journey is to master the elements. Search the Ninja Hideout for paths to new Dojos... and new challenges.

The Brown Puffle was first discovered in January 2011. Explorers crossed a hidden bay into the wilds of Club Penguin, and found them in a cave. Many puffles even followed the explorers back. Adopt one today the Pet Shop.

Fire Ninjas who wear all the parts of their Fire Suit can control fire by pressing 'D' on their keyboard. Many used this power to help melt snow and pump water during the Water Dojo construction in November 2010.

In October 2010, black puffles were found exploring the Mine. It was quickly discovered that they were interested in Cart Surfing. To take your black puffle along, just walk to the Mine and start a game.

name: Mountain Expedition
description: During August 2010, a Mountain Expedition was organized to climb to the top of Toughest Mountain. Many teams of penguins suited up with new climbing gear, and worked together to face the mountain.
Climbers faced many obstacles during the Mountain Expedition in August 2010. Icy caverns and harsh weather made the climb very tiring. Many stopped to rest at base camp before climbing to the summit.

name: Toughest Mountain
description: The final challenge for climbers during the Mountain Expedition in August 2010 was to reach the top. Many who did took a picture to celebrate, which could then be used as a player card background!

To earn all the Stamps in Cart Surfer, you'll need practice... and a little help. For some of the challenges, surfers will need to bring a black puffle with them. You can adopt one of these from the Pet Shop.

name: Stamp Book
description: Stamps Books tell YOUR story. Inside you'll find all the pins you've found, the games you've mastered, and the medals you've earned. Customize yours to show others what you like... and what you can do!
Dark and stormy skies continued to cover the island after the 2010 Halloween Party was over. No one could explain the mysterious weather at first  even Gary the Gadget Guy was baffled.

What do Water Ninjas look like when they're controlling water? That's the question we asked while working on these sketches. We tried lots of different designs, making the water look 'smooth' and 'froamy', until we found the way we liked best.

When the Halloween Storm arrived in October 2010, Gary the Gadget Guy was puzzled. "I had never experienced a storm like it before," he said. "I watched it closely through the binoculars at the Cove. It was very intriguing."

name: Water Ninja
description: Card-Jitsu Water is a fast paced battle. It takes quick thinking and fast flippers to master. Those who do will earn their Water Suit, a Water Gem, and the right to call themselves a Water Ninja.

In November 2010, it rained for the first time in Club Penguin history. For days the downpour soaked the island. Weather experts were baffled, and penguins everywhere were spotted with umbrellas and rain gear.

Ninjas must give their all facing one another in battle. Though matches are fierce, Sensei teaches that competition is the best way to improve your skill. Win or lose, ninjas always remain loyal allies, so remember to tell your opponent "good game!"
A rainstorm drenched the island in November 2010. At Sensei's request, workers set up machines to pump rainwater up to the Dojo. The machines ran on snowballs and Fire Ninja flames!

During November 2010, everyone helped pump rainwater up to the Dojo. This water was needed to build a new Dojo for Water Ninja training. For a week, much of the island was covered in pipes and water tanks.
When a ninja wears all the parts of the Water Suit, they will have the power to control water. Wearing only the suit, press 'D', and a wave of water will surge around you.

The rainstorm in November 2010 was a sign that ninjas were ready to master the element of water. Sensei soon announced the construction of the Water Dojo. It opened on November 25... and Card-Jitsu Water training began.

During construction of the Water Dojo in November 2010, Sensei appeared in the Ninja Hideout. Dressed in his Water Robe, he helped ninjas prepare... and showed them what the power of a Water Ninja could do.

This rough sketch was an idea for a poster, showing all the different parts of the new Card-Jitsu Water game. We wanted to make it feel like the beginning of an ancient legend or story. That's why Sensei is so big  he's not a giant, it's just for style!

This sketch of a Water Ninja was created for a membership card design. We wanted to show how it feels to become a Water Ninja  to have such awesome power and skill. That's why we left off his mask  we wanted to see his expression!
When we were designing what Water Ninjas looked like, it helped to sketch them in different battle poses. We really like this early drawing we found in an artist's sketch book.
"Dude. Soooo love the shades. They make me even stronger and more silent. Maybe later we can hang out and I'll eat a Puffle O to entertain 'ya."
"You think this is fast? You should see how I move when I get shot from a cannon! It's a riot! And I think, actually, it increases happiness."
"Paints, creativity, and music," Chirp replies with whimsy. "Mix those up with some imagination and you got a masterpiece, my friends, a masterpiece!"
"I love bubbles! They're beautiful to blow. Bouncy. Breathtaking. Transparent perfection, I say!"
"Um, nope! Can't touch this propeller hat," Flit laughs loudly. "It takes tons of practice... Even I need it! Recall Christmas 2008 when I got stuck sideways in a tree?!"
"It's so cool to bounce around like my ball," he declares. "By the way... it rolled under a ginormous pile of snow and though I'm small, round and can roll, I'm a bit too puffy. Can you help?"
"Dear Gary, met two very talented puffles on an important PSA mission today. Will have to keep a look out for them in the future. They may be useful someday..."
"From this snowman emerges the almighty Niblet, the might green puffle! He's been trying to become a white puffle by hiding in the snow."
Penguins and puffles never get tired of the snow falling in Club Penguin. Best friends like to take some timeout from their busy life to watch it fall together.
Sometimes rounding up puffles feels a little like chasing a rainbow. Lots of colors, but the closer you get the farther away it seems.
"Yeah, this little green guy is an epic win," Cadence grinned. "He's got all the right moves. He usually knows where the party's at. He's definitely a Keeper, lolz!"
Such a popular myth, they made a Stage play about it. Does this puffle really live under the 'berg?
Swoosh, the mysterious meteor puffle flies through the air with the greatest of ease...
A multi-colored legend, or just a creative little yellow puffle who has been playing with paint?
"I'm telling ya, it was huge! Twice the size of a penguin and it had claws like a crab. I was shaking in my snow boots!"
"Turbo is my black puffle. It rolls its eyes a lot," replies the penguin as he feeds his pet a flipper full of Puffle O's. "It really gets fired up when I take it out for a walk."
"As an employee, I value the blue puffles," replies the staff member. "They are loyal, easy to take care of, and fun to play ball with. You can't go wrong with a blue puffle."
"This is my pink puffle, Cutie! I named it that because I think its eyes are sooo adorable," continues the ballet dancer. "Plus it matches my outfit!"
"My puffle Greenie is the silliest puffle I've ever met, which is why we get along so well," she giggles. "I love it when it plays on its unicycle  it's so funny!"
"Oh! Look at that one over there blowing bubbles! That one is sooo cute  it should be my pet," she exclaims. "I'll make it Princess Purple because I love princesses and purple!"
"This is my sidekick on my adventures. I named it Fireball because it's so fast when it goes flying out of its cannon like whooooosh! Look, it's going again!"
"I knew I wanted a yellow puffle from the moment I saw it in the Forest at Halloween," she replies. "My puffle Lemon likes to paint just like I do."
